Definitions.Paraphrase:
1. computer network 
（计算机）网
World Wide Web 
全球网
2. a net of thin threads made by spider 
蜘蛛网
3. complicated network
复杂的网络
a web of radios
广播网络

act dishonestly; treat someone by lying 
欺骗
He always cheats at cards. 
他玩牌时老玩骗术。
Students may be tempted to cheat in order to get into top schools. 
为进入一流学校，学生可能忍不住作弊。
He cheated the old woman out of her money by making her sign a paper she didn't understand. 
他让这老太太在她看不懂的文件上签名，以此骗取她的钱。

a person who cheats 
骗子
No one likes cheats. 
没人会喜欢骗子。

1. threadlike part in the body that carries feelings and messages to and from the brain 
神经
2. courage; strength or control of mind 
勇气；胆量
He is a man of nerve. 
他是个有勇气的人。
I meant to do it, but I lost my nerve. 
我想干，但我没有勇气。
3. disrespectful manners 
厚颜
He had the nerve to say that I was a fool. 
他居然有脸说我是傻瓜。

1. greatest 
最大的
His ultimate goal at the moment is to go and study out of the country. 
他眼下最大的目标是出国留学。
2. the last or farthest distant; being at the end or happening in the end 
最终的；最后的
The ultimate cost of the job was over a hundred dollars. 
这项工作的最后费用是100多美元。

1. a bad, frightening, or terrible experience or event 
恐怖的经历；可怕的事情
What a nightmare it is to live on a lonely island for ten years! 
一个人在孤岛上生活了10年是个多么可怕的经历啊！
2. an unpleasant and terrible dream 
恶梦
The child awoke suddenly from a nightmare. 
孩子突然从恶梦中醒来。

not allowed; unlawful 
非法的 
Selling alcohol or cigarettes to children is regarded as illicit. 
向小孩子出售酒类和香烟被认为是非法的。

tie; connection 
纽带
Is there a link between smoking and lung diseases? 
吸烟与肺病之间有没有什么联系？

join or connect 
连接
The road links all the new towns. 
这公路将所有的新城镇都连接了起来。
The fingerprints linked that man to the crime. 
指纹将那个人与这件罪案联系了起来。

1.modern; of the present 
当代的
a dictionary of contemporary English 
一部当代英语词典
contemporary history 
当代历史
2.of the same time 
同代的
Keats was contemporary with Shelley.

a person who belongs to the same period of time
同代人
Keats and Shelley were contemporaries.
John is my contemporary; we are both 52. 
约翰和我是同代人，我们都是52岁。

1. make or copy to trick 
伪造；造假
I thought the painting was old but it had been faked. 
我以为这是幅古画，但却是赝品。
The picture was faked by sticking together two photos. 
这张照片是把两张照片拼在一起伪造的。
2. pretend 
假装
She faked illness so that she did not have to go to school. 
她假装生病，这样她就不用上学了。

a person or thing that is not what he/she/it looks like or sth. that is not real 
假货；赝品
His diamond ring looked genuine, but it was a fake.
他的钻戒看起来像真的，但实际是膺品。
I thought he was a minister but he was a fake and robbed me. 
我以为他是个传教士，但实际上是个冒牌货，还抢了我的钱。
The criminal had a fake identity card.
那个犯罪分子有一张伪造的身份证。

right for the occasion; proper; suitable; fitting 
合适的，适当的
Clothes of this kind are not appropriate for school wear.
这种衣服不适合在学校穿。
Fill in each of the blanks with an appropriate word. 
在每个空白处填入一个恰当的词。

transfer something to or from a computer network 
下载
This paper cannot be downloaded for free. 
这篇文章不可免费下载。

1. make peace between; make friendly again 
和解
They quarrelled but now they are completely reconciled. 
他们争吵过，但现在已和好如初。
2. find agreement between (2 actions or ideas) 
调和
I can't reconcile those two ideas.
我无法调和这两种思想。
How do you reconcile your principles with your behavior? 
你怎么使你的原则和行为一致起来？

impossible to bring into agreement 
不可调和的
The partners' differences seem irreconcilable. 
合伙人之间的分歧似乎难以调和。
Good and evil are irreconcilable. 
善与恶不可调和。

a difficult choice between two (bad) things; a problem 
进退维谷；难处
She was in a dilemma as to whether to marry John, who was poor, or Charles, who was ugly. 
是嫁给穷鬼约翰还是嫁给丑八怪查尔斯，她陷入了进退两难的境地。
They managed to find a way out of their dilemma. 
他们设法找到了一个摆脱困境的办法。

a short piece of writing on a subject; an article 
文章；短文
He wrote an essay on Hamlet. 
他写了篇论哈姆雷特的文章。
The essay is about the improper downloading of term papers. 
这篇文章是关于不正当下载学期论文的情况。

cost or charge 
花费；费用
We can't afford the new house; its expense is too high. 
我们买不起这新房子，它的费用太高。
The traveling expense amounts to $2,000. 
旅行费用达到2000美元。
I got the new car at my father's expense. 
我用我爸爸的钱买了这辆新车。

recorded or kept in a file or in a database of information 
存档的
His fingerprints are on-file. 
他的指纹是存了档的。
This is an on-file case. 
这案子档案上有记载。

for each 
每
per kilo 
每公斤
per head 
每人
per sheet 
每张

a person who buys and uses goods and services 
消费者
Some shop owners say they will treat consumers as God but it's not true.
有些店主说他们会将消费者视为上帝，但实际上只是口是心非。
Consumers of jeans are mostly young people.
买牛仔裤的多数是年轻人。

1. willingly 
甘愿
I readily accepted his invitation to a party. 
我欣然接受了他的宴会邀请。
The little boy does not readily reconcile with his sister. 
小男孩不愿与他姐姐和解。
2. quickly and easily
轻易地
His father told me not to believe in people readily. 
他父亲告诉我别轻信别人。

money paid for professional services, to join a club, etc. 
费；酬劳
How much will your lawyer's fee be? 
你将付多少律师费？
The fee for the membership of the club is $20. 
这俱乐部的会费是20美元。

(AmE) either of the two periods into which a year at universities is divided; (BrE) term 
学期
A semester usually consists of 18 weeks. 
一个学期通常有18周。
You'll graduate after this semester. 
这个学期结束你就要毕业了。

a large store selling many different things 
商场
An emporium is a shop. 
商场是个购物的场所。

1. recognize (someone) as important by calling out (a name of honour) 
向欢呼......；拥戴（某人）为......
They hailed him king. 
我们拥戴他为国王。
2. call out to (someone) by name or in a greeting 
招呼
Suddenly, a voice hailed me and there was Jones standing on the other side of the street. 
突然听到有人叫我，原来琼斯就站在马路对面。

the writer
作者
Who is the author of the book? 
谁是这书的作者？
The author of this article points out the problem of illicit downloading of term papers by students.
本文章的作者指出了学生非法下载学期论文的问题。

known to be real; genuine 
真实的
He's got an authentic letter by Shakespeare. 
他弄到了一封莎士比亚的亲笔信。
When you say a painting is a fake, you mean it is not authentic. 
当你说一幅画是赝品时，你是指它不是真品。

1. see 
看见
Did you perceive the mark on the wall? 
你看到墙上的斑点了吗？
A key task is to get pupils to perceive for themselves the relationship between success and effort. 
重要的是让学生自己看到成功与努力之间的关系。
2. take in with the mind; understand 
理解；明白
I soon perceived that I could not make him change his mind. 
我很快就认识到了我无法使他改变主意。
They strangely perceive television as entertainment.
他们奇怪地将电视看作是一种娱乐。

move with a quick, sharp pull of a muscle 
抽动
He twitched his shoulders.
他扭动他的双肩。
When I stood up to her, her right cheek would begin to twitch. 
当我站起来朝她走去时，她的右脸颊就会抽动起来。

a slight, unconscious movement of a muscle or a quick, sharp movement of some part of the body 
抽动
He developed a nervous twitch and began to open and shut his eyes continuously. 
他不安地抽动着，并开始不停地眨眼睛。

1. showing unusual reasoning powers 
有知识的
an intellectual family 
知识分子家庭
Teaching is an intellectual career. 
教书是一种用脑的职业。
2. concerning the ability to reason (rather than to feel or act) 
理智的；智力的
intellectual subjects 
智力课程
Thinking is an intellectual process. 
思维是一个智力活动过程。

a person who is well-informed and intelligent, and interested in activities involving the intellect 
知识分子
Most of the family are intellectuals. 
这家人大多数是知识分子。
Teachers, artists and other intellectuals took part in the march. 
教师、艺术家和其他知识分子参加了这次游行。

1.something owned; possessions 
财产
Police searched thousands of homes and finally found the guns and stolen property.
警察搜查了几千户人家，最终找到了枪支和被盗的财产。
The bicycle is the only property I have now. 
这自行车是我现在惟一的财产了。
2. (area of) land and/ or building(s) 
房地产
The city is growing and property in the center is becoming more valuable.  
城市在扩展，所以市中心的房地产越来越值钱。
Several properties in this street are to be let. 
这街道的几处房产将被租出去。
3. a quality, power, or effect that belongs automatically to something 
属性
What properties do these plants have? 
这些植物有什么特性？

1. an important point 
要点；问题
The key issue for higher education of the new century is to bring the students' creativity into full play.
新世纪高等教育的关键是要充分发挥学生的创造能力。
2. printing at one time of a magazine, etc. 
（书、报等）期、号
I read his article in the March issue of the magazine.
我是在这杂志的三月刊上读到他的文章的。
Here is today's issue of China Daily. 
这是今天的《中国日报》。

1. send out; put forth 
颁布；发行
The government issues a warning that those who won't pay income taxes will be billed.
政府发出了警告，凡不缴纳所得税的人将被罚款。
This official paper is issued by the foreign affairs office. 
这份官方文件是外事办公室签发的。
2. print; publish 
出版；刊行
A monthly magazine is issued every month. 
月刊杂志每月出版一期。

1.tend to; feel drawn to 
倾向；意欲
I inclined to the view that he is right. 
我倾向于认为他是对的。
2. tend to influence or cause (someone) to feel, think, etc. 
使倾向；使意欲
The news inclined me to change my mind. 
这消息使我产生了改变主意的念头。

not believing; doubting or making fun of 
玩世不恭的；好挖苦人的
He is cynical about his boss. 
他在上司面前表现得玩世不恭。
The boys made several cynical remarks to cover up their disappointment at being left out of the play. 
男孩们说了几句玩世不恭的话，以掩饰他们对被排除在剧组之外的失望情绪。

1. idea; understanding 
思想；理解
We have a notion of just what kind of person we'd like to be. 
关于我们想成为什么样的人，各人都有自己的想法。
2. an opinion 
见解
One common notion is that red hair goes with a quick temper.
人们常常认为红头发意味脾气暴躁。
This article deals with some modern notions about the Internet. 
这篇文章说的是现代人对因特网的看法。

range of happening or influence 
发生率；影响范围
The incidence of breast cancer increases with age. 
乳腺癌的发病率随着年龄的增长而增高。

1. an opinion 
观点
In my view, English is a world language. 
以我看，英语是一种世界语。
You and I have the same view on this matter. 
你我对这件事的看法一致。
2. what one can see 
眼界；视域
He stopped in the doorway, blocking her view. 
他站在门口，挡住了她的视野。
He stood up to get a better view of the blackboard. 
他站起来，以便能看清黑板上的字。

1. consider; regard 
考虑
The first-generation Americans viewed the country as a land of opportunity. 
第一代美国人把美国看成是一块充满机会的土地。
We view any helpful ideas seriously. 
我们认真考虑任何有帮助的建议。
2. see; watch 
看；观察
They came back to view the house again. 
他们又折回来查看了一下房子。

having or giving protection 
能防......的
This material is proof against fire. 
这材料是防火的。
That watch is proof against water. 
这手表是防水的。

way of showing that something is true 
证据
You have to give proof of residence in Shanghai. 
你得有居住在上海的证明。
This is not automatically proof that he is wrong. 
这并不一定证明他错了。

protected against cheating
能防止受骗的

order so that each part is properly related to others; build; put together 
组织；构造；建造
He is trying to structure a sentence. 
他正在努力造一个句子。
Language not only depends on its culture, but in turn structures reality for this culture. 
语言不仅依赖其文化，而且反过来为这文化构建现实。

change completely 
改变；改造
She married him with an intention to transform him. 
她嫁给他是想改变他。
She succeeded in transforming him from a hard drinking man into a devoted husband and father. 
她成功地将他从一个酒鬼改变成了一个尽心的丈夫和父亲。

1. a paper containing a review of information or subjects which will be dealt with in a lecture or talk 
印发的讲稿等
Here is Professor Johnson's handout on English literature in the 1920s. 
这是约翰逊教授关于20世纪20年代英国文学的讲稿。
2. something given free 
施舍物
They stood in line for food handouts. 
他们排队领取施舍的食物。

1. a play 
剧（单个戏剧）
He acted in the drama Hamlet. 
他在《哈姆雷特》一剧中担任了角色。
2. plays 
戏剧（戏剧总称）
He knew nothing of Greek drama. 
他对希腊戏剧一无所知。
She met him when she was at a drama school. 
认识他时，她正在戏剧学院读书。
He is studying drama. 
他正在学习戏剧。

1. a story or tale 
故事
This is one of the narratives that children are fond of. 
这是孩子们喜欢的故事之一。
2. the practice or act of telling stories; narration 
叙述；讲故事
The writer had great skill in narrative. 
这位作家是位叙述大师。

that narrates or tells 
叙述的
That is a narrative poem. 
这是一首叙事诗。
Novels belong to narrative art. 
小说属于叙述性的艺术。

hold in check; limit 
抑制；控制
This advertising aimed at curbing the spread of AIDS. 
这则广告旨在抑制艾滋病的蔓延。

a check; limit 
抑制；控制
We have to put a curb on spending. 
我们得压缩开支。
There is a need for a curb on downloading papers.
有必要抑制下载论文的势头。

television, radio, newspapers, etc. 
媒介；媒体
Television, radio, newspapers and magazines are referred to as the media. 
电视、电台、报纸和杂志都可称为媒体。

1.able planning and management of anything 
策略
The Labor Party commenced its new strategy for industry.  
工党提出了其发展工业的新策略。
What should our marketing strategy have achieved? 
我们的销售策略本该取得什么效果？
2. the art of planning movements of armies or forces in war 
战略；兵法
That general is a master of strategy. 
那位将军是位战略大师。
I've just been explaining the basic principles of strategy to my generals. 
我一直在给我的将军们讲解战略的基本原则。

simply; essentially 
基本上
Basically I think he is the boy who broke my window.
我基本上认为他就是打破我窗户的男孩。
He is basically nice. 
他基本上算是个有情趣的人。
Guns are made basically for one purpose — killing people. 
制造枪炮基本上是为了一个目的--杀人。

Definitions.PartofSpeech:
without charge or cost 
免费
The dinner is provided for free.
晚饭是免费供应的。
- How much did you pay for the tickets?
- I didn't pay a penny; I got them for free.
-这些票你付了多少钱？
-我一分未付；我是免费得到的。

give to another; deliver 
递交
If you hand something over to someone, you pass it to him. 
如果你将什么东西递交给什么人，那你就是将它交给他了。
The criminal was handed over to Hong Kong. 
罪犯被移交给香港方面。
"I've got his card," John said, handing it over.
"我有他的名片，" 约翰说，一边将名片递了过来。

do what one wants done; accomplish the purpose 
达到目的
If you want to stop him misbehaving you should punish him. Making him stay at home in the evenings should do the trick. 
如果你想制止他的不良行为，就得惩罚他。让他每晚待在家里就能达到这个目的。
When I go to see Dr. Jose, he always gives me red and yellow pills, and they usually do the trick. 
每次我去看乔斯大夫，他总是给我一些红的和黄的药片，可它们倒也管用。

have the right or permission  to approach, enter, or use; have admittance of 
有权得到、使用等
Students have access to the swimming pool every Saturday. 
每周六学生可去游泳池游泳。
In some way he gets access to the official papers for top managers. 
不知怎么，他能看到高级经理们看的正式文件。

recognize (sth.) as (sth. good) 
称赞......, 为......
Faulkner has been hailed as the greatest American writer of his contemporaries.
福克纳被称赞为他同代人中最伟大的美国作家。
They hailed him as a bright football star.
他们称赞他是一颗耀眼的足球明星。

1.understand (sth. or sb.) with difficulty 
理解
Can you figure out the meaning of the word? 
你能理解这个字的含义吗？
Even the repairman couldn't figure out what had gone wrong with the washer. 
连修理工也弄不明白这洗衣机出什么毛病。
2. consciously study; find out by using figures  
估算
Please figure out how much I owe you.
请算一下我欠你多少钱。
He has figured out how many men he is likely to need.
他算出了他可能需要的人数。

(cause to) be removed from (sth. or sb.) 
搬移；取走
Get your coat off. 
把大衣脱下来。
They managed to get the authentic painting by a famous painter off the wall. 
他们设法将那幅著名画家的真迹从墙上弄了下来。

to a small range or degree 
有点
I'm a little bit tired. 
我有点儿累。
The story is a little bit difficult for me. 
这故事对我来说有点儿难。

be likely to; tending to 
倾向于；容易（做）
I am inclined to agree with you on this point. 
在这一点上，我倾向于赞同你的见解。
I am inclined to think that he has done a better job than any of you. 
我更倾向于认为他做得比你们任何人都好。

to some degree; rather 
有点；有几分
In the end she sort of pushed it. 
最后，她大概推了它一下。
Despite her faults I sort of like her. 
尽管她有缺点，我还是挺喜欢她。

get the best use or greatest gain from 
充分利用
One should make the most of an opportunity. 
一个人应该充分利用机会。
He told me to make the most of what we might spend. 
他告诉我，还能花多少就尽量花。

Cable News Network
（美国）有线新闻电视网
哈姆雷特（莎士比亚戏剧《哈姆雷特》的男主人公）
（此处指）加州大学伯克利分校
阿里亚尼· 彻诺克（人名）
